posts.post_content:
Another locus ([Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost)) is being printed in Scars of Mirrodin.  
  
If you have 4 of these, 4 Glimmerposts, and 4 Vesuva copies of these... Each of these would tap for 12, so that's 96 for all 8 Cloudposts. And another 4 for the Glimmerposts. 12 lands tapping for 100 mana? Yeah, sure, it's colorless, but it's also 100 mana.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
He meant shapeshifter i.e. duplicant, because its colorless mana.. not because it affects lands.
  
   
Ah, cloud post.. bane of my creature deck's existence.. it wouldn't have been so bad if it said something like.. if you have another cloud post in play this land produces +1 colorless mana so that it would only be 2 per land at max. Unfortunately between cloud posts and vesuvas instead it turns into playing darksteel colossus on turn 5, or a fast master transmuter into a sphinx of the steel wind. Mirrodin made artifacts so nuts it seems like they have been making up for it for the past few sets by not printing very many. I mean.. seriously, isochron scepter, lightning greaves, duplicant, and loxodon warhammer all in the same set?
  
   
Having said all that, best card for artifacts decks you could want, makes just about anything castable when you have only 2 out.

Posted By: androkguz (9/22/2010 12:58:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@kulosle  
You're joking, right? This card isn't that powerful? It allows for 16 mana drop on turn 4 with Amulet of Vigor or additional land drops on turn 3 or earlier. It's insanely powerful. It's as broken as someone putting out a land, [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring), [Mana Vault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Vault) on turn 1. No one should have that easy of access to mana that early. It ruins games by trivializing them. Understandably some people like to circle jerk with their combos and they need things like this to enable them. That's fine I suppose -- some people play better with easy mode turned on.  
  
A history of Cloudpost and its ease of use over time:  
  
Cloudpost - Mirrodin - Oct 2003  
Vesuva - Time Spiral - Oct 2006  
Expedition Map - Zendikar - Oct 2009  
Glimmerpost - Scars of Mirrodin - Oct 2010  
Thespian's Stage - Gatecrash - Feb 2013
posts.html:
@kulosle

Posted By: igniteice (3/28/2013 9:41:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ugh, these on their own were ok, if not a slightly tricky way to generate colorless mana due to coming in tapped and needing multiples to get ahead. Vesuva made it much better. Glimmerpost put it into the category of quite viable. And now Thespian's Stage has just made it silly. 16 post? It was fine at 8, good at 12, and now is ridiculous at 16.  
  
For the record, if you were to have all 16 Locus-able lands out, you'd be able to generate 196 mana. Just from lands. Absurd! With a Glimmerpost and 3 'Cloudposts' out, that's 13 mana on turn 4. Turn 4 hard cast Ulamog from lands alone. >.>  
  
For a normal 16 post build... 4x Cloudpost, 4x Glimmerpost, 4x Vesuva and 4x Thespian's Stage. Leaving ~8 or so other lands up to you; Deserted Temple is pretty good in that if you have a Cloudpost generating at least 3 mana, Deserted Temple will ultimately tap for 2. For the other 4 - plenty of options. Reliquary Tower for hand size, Wasteland for land destruction, Tower of the Magistrate to deal with equ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: DaJoshMaster (1/16/2013 2:59:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I don't think this card is as over powered as people think, it comes into play tapped so you can't do anything with it turn one, and on turn two you only have two mana to spend any ways, even if you are lucky enough to get [Amulet of Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Vigor) in your opening hand. compared to other mana ramp it actually lacks. and are you really going to run 4 amulet of vigor? and even then you might not get it, so what do you do run search cards? well now even more cards in you deck don't do anything. also this is assuming you get all of your cloudposts and vesuvas on que, which is unlikely and there is only a small number of cards you can use to search for them, and only one of them isn't green. so what are you going to do? run more search cards? run mana fixing to play green spells? or you could just go mono green and play all your eldrazi just as quick but more reliably.
